business.headline: US Fed rate cut by 25 bps: How will it impact Sensex, Nifty today?According to early trends, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 26,188 points as of 7:45 am, suggesting that the Nifty 50 may open above Wednesday's closing level of 26,053.9.

Gold and silver prices recover from recent lows. Is it time to buy?After slipping to three-week lows earlier this week, gold and silver have regained some shine ahead of the US Fed's policy decision. As markets anticipate a possible rate cut, traders are now weighing whether this rebound marks a good buying opportunity.

Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to reach USD 5 trillion market valueThe milestone, reached just three months after Nvidia crossed USD 4 trillion, now surpasses the entire cryptocurrency market's value and equals nearly half of Europe's benchmark Stoxx 600 index.

Significant progress made in India-EU trade talks: Piyush Goyal after key meetsThe minister said that both sides are working towards a fair and reputable trade agreement, which will benefit businesses and consumers in India and the EU alike.

boAt's parent Imagine Marketing refiles for Rs 15-billion IPO after 2022 delayTwo years after postponing its IPO plans, boAt's parent company Imagine Marketing is back in the game, filing fresh documents for a Rs 15-billion public issue.

Can India's banks keep up with the economy's growth momentum?With growth and policy support aligned, India's economy is gaining momentum. The real question — can banks modernise fast enough to keep it going?

Sensex, Nifty end higher amid optimism over US Fed decisionThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 368.97 points to close at 84,997.13, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 117.70 points to settle at 26,053.90. Broader market indices also closed higher, with oil & gas and metal stocks leading the uptrend.

The story of the sons in Tata SonsTata Sons Private Limited, established in 1917, is the principal holding company and promoter of the Tata Group, India's largest and one of the world's most respected conglomerates.

Want to earn 3–4x more? These 4 countries are actively hiring IndiansSkilled Indians are catching the world's attention. An expert says that Germany, Japan, Finland and Taiwan — are actively hiring Indian professionals and offering salaries up to three to four times higher than those in India.

Why are NRIs flocking to buy homes in India?The transformation of India's real estate ecosystem has further strengthened this trust of the NRIs. Over the past decade, reforms such as the RERA improved project transparency, digitisation of land records and professionalisation of developers have collectively boosted buyer confidence.

8th Pay Commission: Cabinet clears terms of reference. What does this mean?With the Cabinet approving the Terms of Reference for the 8th Central Pay Commission, the countdown begins for the next pay and pension revision that could reshape earnings for millions of central government employees and pensioners.

India's organised farmstay market set to touch Rs 63,000 crore by 2029As city life grows more chaotic and polluted, many urban Indians are finding peace in the countryside. The growing shift towards wellness and greener living is now driving India's organised farmstay market to new heights.

The billion-dollar goodbye: Why global tech giants are spending more to let people goIn this deep-dive on global tech layoffs, we analyse severance costs, project realignments, and slowing demand cycles to understand why companies are standardising leaner headcounts and shifting toward automation-driven operational efficiency.

Gold, silver prices rise slightly ahead of US Fed decision. Check latest ratesOn the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), Gold December futures were trading at Rs 1,19,755 per 10 grams at 9:43 am, up modestly from Tuesday's close. Silver December futures were quoted at Rs 1,44,768 per kg, also showing a slight uptick after recent losses.

Sensex, Nifty open higher tracking Asian markets; US Fed decision in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex was trading 153.31 points higher at 84,781.47, while the NSE Nifty50 hovered just below the 26,000 level after briefly crossing it during early trade.

Gold and silver prices fall sharply. Should you buy now?With gold and silver prices falling sharply, investors are eyeing the market closely. Is now the right time to buy, or could prices dip further?

Amazon to cut 14,000 corporate jobs amid company's AI push to slash costsAmazon will cut about 14,000 corporate jobs, its biggest layoffs since 2023, as it ramps up artificial intelligence investments and trims costs under CEO Andy Jassy's ongoing restructuring plan.

Apple joins Microsoft, Nvidia in exclusive $4 trillion market-cap clubApple is now the third member of the $4 trillion market-cap club, joining Nvidia—currently valued above $4.5 trillion—and Microsoft, which re-entered the group following gains linked to its partnership with OpenAI.
Sensex, Nifty end slightly lower amid volatility and profit bookingThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 75.11 points to close at 84,703.73 and the NSE Nifty50 fell 29.85 points to settle at 25,936.20.

Mehli Mistry set to exit Tata Trusts after trustees block reappointmentMehli Mistry, who joined both trusts in 2022, has been regarded as a close associate of the late Ratan Tata. The Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and the Sir Ratan Tata Trust together hold the largest shareholding in Tata Sons and play a central role in board nominations and governance across the Tata Group.

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss 19: Ashnoor Kaur's body-shaming on show proves we still haven't evolved 'Bigg Boss 19' contestants Tanya Mittal, Kunickaa Sadanand, and Neelam Giri have been facing backlash for body-shaming Ashnoor Kaur. Here's why the incident is a reminder that we, as a society, still haven't evolved.

Enrique Iglesias turns Mumbai into a dance floor on day 1 of concert  Enrique Iglesias returned to Mumbai after 13 years with a sold-out concert at MMRDA Grounds. The performance united multiple generations and reignited the city's love for his music.

KJo, Malaika compare contestant to Shashi Tharoor, his epic comeback is gold Congress MP Shashi Tharoor's trademark wit was on full display after Karan Johar and Malaika Arora compared a 'Pitch To Get Rich' contestant to him. His playful response on social media went viral, with fans urging the trio to meet and clear the fun confusion.

Camila Mendes engagement bash turns into a mini Riverdale reunion. Pics The cast of 'Riverdale' reunited at Camila Mendes' surprise engagement party, evoking nostalgic memories of 2017. Camila Mendes, who played Veronica Lodge, got engaged to her longtime boyfriend Rudy Mancuso.

Harshvardhan Rane: The outsider once called a fluke, now turns dismissal into power From being called a fluke to earning love twice at the box office this year, Harshvardhan Rane opens up about rejection, healing, and finding peace. He reflects on why he refuses to blame nepotism and how romanticising pain became his greatest strength.

BTS Jungkook sets pulses racing in new photoshoot: Feels good to be back BTS' Jungkook makes a striking comeback as the face of Calvin Klein's 2025 campaign. The luxury shoot, where the BTS star raises the temperature, has sent fans into a frenzy ahead of BTS' 2026 reunion.

Justin Bieber's take on cheating divides fans: Even a thought of lust is adultery Justin Bieber has sparked a fresh debate on fidelity by stating that even lustful thoughts amount to cheating. He said this amounts to adultery.

Adam Driver to headline Netflix's high-stakes hostage drama Rabbit, Rabbit Netflix has greenlit a new thriller, 'Rabbit, Rabbit', starring Adam Driver. Written by Peter Craig and directed by Philip Barantini, the hostage drama, likened to 'Dog Day Afternoon', promises a tense psychological showdown.

BB19 Episode 67: Mridul's captaincy tested, Farrhana refuses duties; house in chaos From captain Mridul's tears and walk-out threats to Farrhana's shocking accusations, the 'Bigg Boss 19' house drama peaked just before the new science task began.

Arshad Warsi admits regretting Jaani Dushman, did the film for money to build home Actor Arshad Warsi expressed regret over his role in the 2002 film 'Jaani Dushman'. Despite this, he highlighted director Rajkumar Kohli's generosity and professionalism, which helped him financially.

Diljit Dosanjh reacts to racist remarks in Sydney, calls for world beyond borders Actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh shared a video on YouTube that featured behind-the-scenes footage of his AURA tour in Australia. He also opened up on the racism he faced ahead of his Sydney concert.

Priyanka Chopra poses with pythons in throwback photos, hints a Mowgli connection Priyanka Chopra shared a series of pictures posing with pythons and a cobra. The post includes throwback images and features her husband Nick Jonas, sparking fan reactions.

De De Pyaar De 2: Watch Ajay, Rakul's new hook-step in Honey Singh's Jhoom Sharaabi Ajay Devgn and Rakul Preet Singh's party track 'Jhoom Sharaabi' was released. The song mixes classic Qawwali with modern beats and a unique hook-step.

Battle of Galwan: Amitabh Bachchan's viral photo from set sparks buzz A recent photo of Amitabh Bachchan from the set of Salman Khan's upcoming film 'Battle of Galwan' has led to widespread curiosity online. Many social media users are wondering if the veteran actor has joined the much-anticipated war drama.

Lakshya celebrates The Ba***ds of Bollywood success with a new swanky car Bollywood actor Lakshya marked the success of 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' by buying a new red MG Cyberster. He was seen driving around Mumbai in his new car and posed for the paparazzi.

Kathryn Bigelow on Pentagon criticism of A House of Dynamite: I state the truth Director Kathryn Bigelow's latest film has drawn Pentagon criticism over its depiction of the US nuclear missile defence system. The debate raises questions about the balance between realism and official defence claims.

Rajinikanth flies economy to Goa for Jailer 2, greets passengers onboard. Video Superstar Rajinikanth was recently seen travelling in economy class to Goa for the shoot of his film 'Jailer 2'. Videos of the actor greeting fans and fellow passengers on the flight have gone viral on social media.

As Thamma hits Rs 100 crore, Ayushmann and Aparshakti treat fans with fun video Actors Ayushmann and Aparshakti Khurrana marked the box office success of 'Thamma' with a light-hearted video. The horror-comedy film crossed the Rs 100-crore mark on Wednesday.

general news.headline: Trump, Xi Jinping meet in South Korea after 6 years in bid to ease US-China riftThe meeting in Busan, South Korea, marks the first encounter between the two presidents since Trump's return to office in January. Their last meeting was at the 2019 G20 Summit in Osaka during Trump's first term.

China's development aligns with vision to make America great again: Xi to TrumpChinese President Xi Jinping and US President Donald Trump met in Busan, South Korea, signalling a hopeful tone towards stabilising economic ties and global peace efforts. Both leaders acknowledged differences but emphasised partnership for mutual development.

Trump ends 30-year pause, orders immediate nuclear tests over Russia, China movesUS President Donald Trump has announced immediate nuclear weapons testing to match advancements by Russia and China. This move signals a renewed phase in America's nuclear weapons programme amid rising global tensions.

US drones, not India, real reason why Pak-Afghan peace talks crashedPakistan Defence Minister Khwaja Asif blamed India after the peace talks with Taliban-ruled Afghanistan failed. Though Islamabad might use that as the ruse, the real reason behind the crashing of the talks, which were initiated after a recent war got hundreds killed, is Pakistan's helplessness at preventing US drones from attacks inside Afghanistan.

Mountain to climb: Can India script an epic to stop the Australia juggernaut?Women's World Cup 2025, IND vs AUS Preview: Australia head into the semi-final as clear favourites, but Harmanpreet Kaur's India will back themselves to challenge the seven-time champions at the Dr DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Pak Army captain among 6 soldiers killed in clash with Taliban near Afghan borderA Pakistani Army captain and five soldiers were killed in a clash with Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) militants near the Afghan border in Kurram district.

Iran, Russia are building a railway line that could destroy western sanctionsAs Washington tightens its grip, Tehran and Moscow are laying tracks for a trade revolution that bypasses the West entirely. The question is no longer if sanctions will fail, but when.

Devils on horseback, rape for Arab babies, and gold mines: Why Sudan burnsSudan's military withdrew from its last western stronghold in Darfur, ceding control of El-Fasher city to the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF). The RSF started off as Janjaweed or devils on horseback, a militia of Arabs that raped and murdered animists and Christians. Sudan's gold mines and the UAE's interest in them add another dimension to the bloody history that has seen tens of thousands killed and millions displaced.

Diljit Dosanjh reacts to racist remarks in Sydney, calls for world beyond bordersActor-singer Diljit Dosanjh shared a video on YouTube that featured behind-the-scenes footage of his AURA tour in Australia. He also opened up on the racism he faced ahead of his Sydney concert.

Living freely in Delhi: Sheikh Hasina says has no plans of leaving IndiaIn rare interviews, ousted Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina said that she was living freely but cautiously in Delhi and had no intentions of leaving India. She also warned that millions of voters would boycott the election in Bangladesh if her party, the Awami League, wasn't allowed to participate in it.

Push them back to caves: Pakistan's Asif threatens Afghan Taliban after talks failPakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif threatened to obliterate the Afghan Taliban after failed peace talks, warning of a Tora Bora repeat if terror attacks in Pakistan continue from Afghan soil.

Why dismantling India's polio network could invite the virus back, say doctorsIndia plans to reduce its polio disease monitoring system. The move could risk allowing polio and other diseases to resurface amid ongoing regional virus threats.

Distressed woman breaks AC coach window after purse theft as child watches onThe viral video shows the visibly distraught woman repeatedly striking and breaking the windowpane of her compartment, ignoring fellow passengers who requested her to stop.

Hire Americans first: Florida ends H-1B visa hiring across state universitiesFlorida Governor Ron DeSantis bans H-1B visas at state universities, ordering institutions to hire Americans instead of foreign workers, citing visa abuse and prioritising local graduates for taxpayer-funded jobs.

On ground in Bihar: Praise for NDA's policies, concerns over patchy implementationFrom Patna's gleaming airport to Punpun's dry taps, Bihar shows signs of progress shadowed by old frustrations. As the NDA banks on goodwill and welfare, corruption and unemployment continue to test the state's faith in change.

Kash Patel accused of jetting to girlfriend's wrestling gig amid shutdownEx-FBI agent Kyle Seraphin mocked FBI Director Kash Patel on X, accusing him of using an FBI jet to attend his girlfriend's wrestling event while employees go unpaid during the government shutdown.

Harshvardhan Rane: The outsider once called a fluke, now turns dismissal into powerFrom being called a fluke to earning love twice at the box office this year, Harshvardhan Rane opens up about rejection, healing, and finding peace. He reflects on why he refuses to blame nepotism and how romanticising pain became his greatest strength.

Gold and silver prices recover from recent lows. Is it time to buy?After slipping to three-week lows earlier this week, gold and silver have regained some shine ahead of the US Fed's policy decision. As markets anticipate a possible rate cut, traders are now weighing whether this rebound marks a good buying opportunity.

Caught on CCTV: Cop steals Rs 2 lakh, phone from friend's home; on the runA female DSP in Bhopal was caught on CCTV stealing Rs 2 lakh in cash and a mobile phone from her friend's house. After the footage surfaced, police registered an FIR, but the accused officer has gone absconding.

She entered as a 'special case.' She left as India's first woman engineerThe untold story of Ayyalasomayajula Lalitha, India's first woman engineer who entered college as a "special case" and rewired the future.

Adulting is hard, but it's harder when your parents are fightingWatching your parents fight as an adult can feel deeply unsettling. You feel helpless, full of thoughts and emotions, yet unable to say or do much. And even if you don't show it, the emotional weight of those moments can be heavy.

Siwan's storm: Bulldozers, kites and the battle for Bihar's Muslim voteHeavyweights, from Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath to Union Minister Amit Shah and AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi, have descended on Siwan as the small town in Bihar has now suddenly become the state's most sought-after political address.

500 Indians from Myanmar scam hub stranded in Thailand; Delhi trying to helpIndia is cooperating with Thailand to return nearly 500 Indian nationals after fleeing a cybercrime hub in neighbouring Myanmar. The move follows a military raid that forced hundreds, including Indians, to cross into Thailand, where they are under detention.

Watch: US forces sink narco-terror vessel in Pacific strike, 4 killedUS Defense Secretary Peter Hegseth said a US military strike destroyed a narco-trafficking vessel in the Eastern Pacific, killing four suspected smugglers. He warned, no safe haven for narco-terrorists.

sports.headline: Storm Alert: How India can clip Alyssa Healy's wings in the semis Women's World Cup, IND vs AUS: Alyssa Healy has been a force in ICC knockout matches, scoring centuries in both the 2022 semifinal and final. Can India find a way to stop her from going big again on Thursday in Navi Mumbai?

IND vs AUS, Women's World Cup semi-final weather: Will rain spoil Navi Mumbai clash? India's Women face defending champions Australia in a high-stakes World Cup semi-final at Navi Mumbai. But with rain threats looming, fans are left hoping the weather doesn't decide the outcome.

From 97-all-out to 319/7: How South Africa changed their fortune in semi-final South Africa went from 97-all-out against in their last group-stage game against Australia to hitting 319 runs in the semi-final against England. What changed? Marizanne Kapp reveals.

IND vs AUS, predicted XI: Toss up between Harleen, Radha in semi-final India are set to play Australia in the semi-final of the ODI World Cup. Will India make multiple changes in their line-up for knockout game?

Mountain to climb: Can India script an epic to stop the Australia juggernaut? Women's World Cup 2025, IND vs AUS Preview: Australia head into the semi-final as clear favourites, but Harmanpreet Kaur's India will back themselves to challenge the seven-time champions at the Dr DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

IND vs AUS, Women's World Cup: What happens if semis gets washed out by rain? Women's World Cup: It is expected to rain in Navi Mumbai on Thursday, during India's semi-final against Australia. What happens if the match gets washed out?

KL Rahul triggers IPL 2026 trade buzz with cheeky remark in new podcast KL Rahul's recent remarks have set off speculation over his IPL future as reports link him with a potential move from Delhi Capitals to Kolkata Knight Riders. The star batter's journey from IPL debutant to one of the league's most consistent performers adds intrigue to the ongoing trade discussions.

Tears of joy: Marizanne Kapp buries ghosts of 2017 with 5-wicket spell in semis South Africa qualified for their first-ever ICC Women's World Cup final after defeating England by 125 runs. Marizanne Kapp's five-wicket haul and Laura Wolvaardt's 169 runs powered the historic victory.

Wolvaardt and Kapp fire South Africa into maiden final, send England home Women's World Cup: South Africa stormed into their maiden Women's World Cup final with a commanding 100-run win over England at the Barsapara Stadium in Guwahati on Wednesday. Laura Wolvaardt's sublime century and Marizanne Kapp's all-round brilliance powered the Proteas to a historic victory.

No favourites in the semi-final of World Cup: Australia head coach Women's World Cup: Australia head coach believes that there are no favourites in the semi-final. Shelley Nitschke, speaking in the press conference said that Australia were wary of India's batting depth.

Australia to take late call on Alyssa Healy in semi-finals: Coach Nitschke Women's World Cup: Australia are wary of India's batting depth, said head coach Shelley Nitschke ahead of the team's semi-final against the hosts. The coach also said that Australia would take a late call on playing Alyssa Healy.

The star batter's journey from IPL debutant to one of the league's most consistent performers adds intrigue to the ongoing trade discussions.

Australia to take late call on Alyssa Healy in semi-finals: Coach Nitschke Women's World Cup: Australia are wary of India's batting depth, said head coach Shelley Nitschke ahead of the team's semi-final against the hosts. The coach also said that Australia would take a late call on playing Alyssa Healy.

God-sent Shafali Verma unfazed by Aussie firepower before semifinal testWomen's World Cup semi-final: Shafali Verma returns to the big stage after an unexpected call-up to India's World Cup squad. At just 21, with the experience of having faced the mighty Australians on numerous occasions, the opener is now eyeing a decisive impact in the high-stakes clash in Navi Mumbai on Thursday, 30 October.

Australia will come hard at us, but I'll back my strengths: Shafali VermaWomen's World Cup 2025, IND vs AUS: In the pre-match press conference, Shafali Verma said that she'll play her natural game, knowing that Australia will come hard at India when these two teams meet on Thursday at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Vinicius apologises for Clasico outburst: Sometimes passion gets better of meReal Madrid striker Vinicius Jr. apologised for his outburst during the El Clasico. The footballer had lashed out after being substituted during the high-intensity encounter.

Laura Wolvaardt hits 169, first captain to score century in World Cup knockoutsEngland vs South Africa, Women's World Cup semifinal: South Africa captain Laura Wolvaardt smashed 169 off 143 deliveries, becoming the first captain to hit a hundred in a knockout game in the premier 50-over tournament's history. South Africa posted 319 in 50 overs in the semifinal in Guwahati.

Suryakumar Yadav joins Rohit Sharma in elite list with explosive show in CanberraIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav reached 150 sixes in T20Is during the first match against Australia. He completed the milestone in 86 innings, becoming the fifth batter overall to reach the milestone.

41-year-old Sunil Chhetri signs new deal with Bengaluru FCLegendary Sunil Chhetri seems to have signed a new deal with Bengaluru FC. The club teased a video of his contract extension with a heartwarming video.

41-year-old Sunil Chhetri signs new deal with Bengaluru FCLegendary Sunil Chhetri seems to have signed a new deal with Bengaluru FC. The club teased a video of his contract extension with a heartwarming video.

Suryakumar Yadav finds form before rain ends series opener in CanberraIndia vs Australia, 1st T20I: The opening T20I between India and Australia was abandoned due to persistent rain in Canberra. The washout denied fans a result but showcased Suryakumar Yadav's promising return and Abhishek Sharma's aggressive batting.

Miscommunication with Afghanistan board cleared: Coach Trott makes U-turnAfghanistan head coach Jonathan Trott has confirmed that any previous miscommunication with the Afghanistan Cricket Board (ACB) has been resolved, with both parties now on the same page ahead of the T20I series against Zimbabwe.

17-year-old Anahat Singh stuns defending champion to reach Canadian Open semis17-year-old Indian squash prodigy Anahat Singh stormed into the semi-final of the Canadian Open by beating defending champion Tinnie Gilis. This is the first time that Anahat beat a top-10-ranked player.

Shashi Tharoor slams selectors for ignoring Sarfaraz despite rich formCongress MP Shashi Tharoor criticises Indian selectors for excluding Sarfaraz Khan from the Test team despite his impressive domestic and international records. He stressed the need to value consistent domestic cricket performances over IPL form in team selection.

KL Rahul reveals hilarious banter with Kevin Pietersen's wife in EnglandKL Rahul lifted the lid on his playful camaraderie with Kevin Pietersen during the 2025 Indian Premier League, recounting how their light-hearted banter extended beyond the field to Pietersen's wife, Jessica.

Rohit Sharma's Crowning Glory: When Rohit Sharma First Became World No.1This special report revisits the historic moment when 'Hitman' Rohit Sharma first claimed the top spot in the ICC ODI batter rankings. At 38, he became the oldest player to achieve this milestone after a stellar performance in the ODI series against Australia, which included a match-winning unbeaten century. The report examines the key performances that led to this achievement, including his record-breaking run in the 2019 World Cup where he became the first batsman to score five centuries in a single tournament. A significant quote from the time highlights the magnitude of the event: 'Rohit Sharma has created history by becoming the number one ranked player for the very first time in his career as far as ICC ranking is concerned.' This milestone cemented his legacy as one of India's all-time greatest white-ball cricketers.

Rohit Sharma's Crowning Glory: When Rohit Sharma First Became World No.1This special report revisits the historic moment when 'Hitman' Rohit Sharma first claimed the top spot in the ICC ODI batter rankings. At 38, he became the oldest player to achieve this milestone after a stellar performance in the ODI series against Australia, which included a match-winning unbeaten century. The report examines the key performances that led to this achievement, including his record-breaking run in the 2019 World Cup where he became the first batsman to score five centuries in a single tournament. This milestone cemented his legacy as one of India's all-time greatest white-ball cricketers.

1st semi-final highlights: Kapp, Wolvaardt fire South Africa into World Cup finalWomen's World Cup 2025, England (ENG) vs South Africa (SA) 1st semi-final live score: South Africa hammered England by 125 runs to reach their maiden ODI World Cup final. Marinzanne Kapp's sensational five-wicket haul and Laura Wolvaardt's record-breaking 169 take them past the finish line. South Africa will head to Navi Mumbai, which will host the final on Sunday. India and Australia will meet in the second semifinal on Thursday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
